page.description: For internal use only. Get the base variable space for a thread.

argument.name: P
argument.description: A pointer to all of the variables of a specific thread.

page.discussion: The THREAD_VARIABLES() function returns a pointer to all of the variables of a specific thread. This can be used to peek at what a background thread is doing or to set variables within that thread. No user interface related commands are allowed in a thread. Using any command that attempts to create or manipulate any type of user interface from within a thread will cause Alpha Anywhere to hang. Examples of such invalid functions include debug() , ui_*, StatusBar.*, ControlPanel.*, trace.*, etc. .
